law.catch_line: Land acquired by condemnation or damage suit -- Copy of judgment to be recorded.
law.text: When the state acquires title to any land or interest in land, as contemplated by KRS 56.020, by condemnation proceedings or through payment of damages for an injury to land, the Secretary of State shall be furnished a copy, certified by the clerk of the court, of the judgment vesting such title in the state, and shall be furnished the other information required by KRS 56.040. The Secretary of State shall keep and record such information as provided in KRS 56.020.
law.history: Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 2337a-4.
